sec.p: It is a perennial or biennial plant, with a height of 20–50 cm, fluffy short shaggy slept together, having relatively thick, hard, single, and grooved stems. It has often large ramifications, corymb-shaped, leaves with bases of the dimensions 3.5–22 cm × 12–40 cm with the broad triangular or oval area, with three times shoulders deep divisions, with triangular-wide long-term parts and also from base to middle divided twice to 5–7 linear narrow passage, with white tips at the end, stem leaves with deep shoulder divisions, with nondivided parts or with 2–3 teeth and pale yellow flowers, with downy petals, nonradial, integrated in multiple umbrellas with 2–3[ 5] short beam, with 2–10 mm length, not equal height, bracts of short collar, bayonet, the triangular bayonet of the bracts, hard, long and wide pyramidal fruit, no rag or blade, umbelet of fruit-bearing 8 mm diameter, more or less ovate; flowering time is June to July.[ 16]
